pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:0.5: 15. The training rule on swaying the body
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swaying and leaning their bodies while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.3.1: “‘I will not sway my body while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.4: One should not sway one’s body while walking in an inhabited area;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.5: one should walk keeping one’s body straight.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.6: If a monk, out of disrespect, sways and leans his body while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk15:1.10: The fifth training rule is finished.
